issue.title: [CF 518] No icon groups in config mode for Resto Druids (MoP Beta)
issue.body:
Submitted Via

Curse Client 5.1.1.410, Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1

Installed Version

r529-nolib

Description

Command "/tmw" does not open the config mode correctly. There's the message "You are in config mode" but there are no panels (icon groups) visible.

Steps to Reproduce

Type "/tmw" or open config via interface menu. Installed addons (incl. their requ. libs): - Clique - Dominos - Quartz - TellMeQhen - VuhDo Tried also to install requ. libraries for all installed addons separately but same behaviour. Kind regards, Wytheron@Zuluhed

Installed Addons

Ace3 - Release-r1041 AceGUI-3.0-SharedMediaWidgets - v3.4.1 CallbackHandler-1.0 - 1.0.7 Clique - v40300-1.5.2 Dominos - 4.3.4 DRData-1.0 - v2.7-1-g1608067 LibDogTag-3.0 - r250 LibDogTag-Unit-3.0 - r232 LibSharedMedia-3.0 - 6 LibStub - 1.0.2-40200 Quartz - 3.0.8-nolib SharedMedia - r182 TellMeWhen - r529-nolib VuhDo - VuhDo 2.138


> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron | Imported from CurseForge issue #518 | Raw

comments.body:
Seeing as you are using an alpha version, your probably not a new user of TellMeWhen, but I will offer these basic suggestions anyway, just in case: If there are no groups shown in config mode, this could indicate a few things:

  1. None of your groups are set to show for your current talent tree (Balance, Feral, Restoration)
  2. None of your groups are set to show for your current talent specialization (Primary/Secondary)
  3. Your groups have been moved off your screen (unlikely, but possible.)

All of the above issues can be solved by typing '/tmw options' and changing these settings for your current groups, or by adding new groups.

What is the much more likely cause of the error, however is that there is a Lua error occurring that is preventing the proper execution of the code that handles TMW's configuration mode. Make sure Lua errors are enabled in Blizzard's interface options (under the Help sub-category) and post any errors that pop up that pertain to TellMeWhen.

If you already have Lua errors enabled, however, and no errors are occurring, then the best way for me to diagnose this issue would be to have you upload your SavedVariables file. Saved variables can be found in: "World of Warcraft/WTF/Account/<Account Name>/SavedVariables/TellMeWhen.lua". You can paste the contents of the file to http://wow.curseforge.com/paste/ and link to it here, or user another method to provide me with the file.

Looking forward to getting your issue resolved! Thank you for using TellMeWhen!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Hi Cybeloras!

Thanks for the quick reply. I've already checked the points you suggested (talent spec, primary/secondary spec).

What I did: I took the config file from the live cata client and searched/replaced all occurences of character and realm name to the ones of my toon on the beta server. After the first start (having no other addons installed/active at this point of time) all my groups where there, but some of the displayed icons had a fency lime color, so I adjusted the Custom Icon value to use the proper icon/spell IDs. After that maybe I became a little too brave and installed the other addons mentioned in my initial posting. From this moment on I was not able to get the groups back to be displayed. I also reset the whole TMW configuration (deleted config file) and installed libs separately for each addon but it didn't work out.

I will try to enable LUA error output when I'm back at home tonight and provide the information for you.

What would be the best way to reset the groups to the screen center in case they dropped off the screen or is there any way at all besides deleting the config file? (^-^)

Kind regards, Wytheron

BTW: I <3 TMW and I missed it very much when I did my first serious Beta gaming yesterday. ;)


> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron

To reset group position, go into the group settings, click the position tab, and click 'reset position'.

Try disabling all addons except TMW and see if it comes back. If it does, slowly enable your addons a few at a time until you find the one that is causing the issue. Let me know what addon it is so that I can look into a fix.

> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron

That is very, very strange. They should all three be checked by default. I will go investigate right now.

For the saved variables, I need World of Warcraft/WTF/Account/<ACCOUNT NAME>/SavedVariables/TellMeWhen.lua. Having this might help me figure out why resto was unchecked.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

And it gets even stranger.....because in all my desparation (before I got it to work) I deleted the TMW lua files. So in my SavedVariables folder there are only lua files for: - Blizzard_CombatLog - Clique - Dominos - Quartz - Recount - Vuhdo and - VuhdoOptions

When I start WoW (Beta Client) without a TellMeWhen.lua in <wow_folder>\WTF\Account\<my_account>\SavedVariables\ (as it would be when freshly installed, right?) the "Restoration" check box is not checked.

What confuses me a little is that you said "they should all three be checked by default" but keep in mind that druids now have not only 3 but 4(!) talent specs (Guardian, Feral (DPS), Balance and Restoration). Maybe this is where the trouble lies. Are the check boxes iterated over (array style) and the index variable used only counts to 3 instead of 4 when initializing the checked state?


> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron

Oh, crap. I forgot about that. The number of specs is hardcoded as 3 (In the default settings. The checkboxes in the group options are generated dynamically), which would be the problem. Should get fixed in the next revision.

No need for you to upload your saved variables now, since that is definitely the problem.

Edited Aug 13, 2012
